page.title: 16Personalities in Alford
page.content: Both our local personalities are natives of the Vale of Alford. William MacDonald joined his father at Montgarrie Mill as an apprentice miller in 1930. 54 years later he retired and his son,Donald,took over as miller.He has held several positions of influence in the Vale, master of the freemasons, a trustee of the Murray Memorial Trust and chairman of the trustees of the Murray Park which the poet Charles Murray gave to the people of Alford. Madge Robb,SWRI member and hallkeeper, is a familiar figure in Alford riding her bike and giving everyone a cheery wave and shout.Over the years she has cared for many old people and at present is home-help to four. She makes fine preserves and home baking, and enjoys bowling and country dancing
